Methods in wator that return Loc

          Returns the location of this creature This answer is more for convenience, to avoid searching the entire map.

          Returns the location at the specified x,y coordinates
 Loc WatorModel.getLoc(Loc origin, Direction dir)
          Returns the location next to the origin in the specified direction
 Loc Loc.getNeighbor(Direction dir)
          Provides the neighboring loc in the direction specified
 Loc[] Loc.sortLocs(Loc other)
          Returns two locations sorted into a consistent order to prevent deadlocks
 

Methods in wator that return types with arguments of type Loc
 java.util.ArrayList<Loc> Shark.availableMoves()
           
 java.util.ArrayList<Loc> Pisces.availableMoves()
          Returns all possible locations that this creature could move to This method is somewhat general, but it should work for fish.
 

Methods in wator with parameters of type Loc
 boolean Shark.canOccupy(Loc destination)
           
 boolean Pisces.canOccupy(Loc destination)
          Check whether this creature can go to the specified location Here we only check if the location is empty, but Sharks should override to allow a move to a fish's location.
 Loc WatorModel.getLoc(Loc origin, Direction dir)
          Returns the location next to the origin in the specified direction
 boolean Shark.moveTo(Loc destination)
           
 boolean Pisces.moveTo(Loc destination)
          Move this creature from its origin to a new destination This method is called from the run() method Leave a baby behind if it's time, starting a thread for the baby
 void Pisces.setLoc(Loc loc)
          Sets the recorded location of this creature.
 Loc[] Loc.sortLocs(Loc other)
          Returns two locations sorted into a consistent order to prevent deadlocks
